info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lackawanna County through 645 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clarks Summit, or near Waverly, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Dunmore, Old Forge, Archbald, Blakely, Taylor, Dickson City, Moosic, Olyphant and Clarks Summit. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 182 and 194. Interstate 84 between 1 and 2, and near 4. Interstate 380 near 24. Interstate 476 between 122 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
